instruction: How was the modified simple linear iterative clustering (SLIC) method used to generate superpixels in hyperspectral images for the detection of GB brain tumors in the related study combining hyperspectral imaging and digital pathology?

Superpixels are regions of pixels that can be classified according to their spectral information. The SLIC method was modified to accommodate hyperspectral (HS) images. These superpixels are generated by clustering pixels based on their spatial proximity and spectral similarity. By using the SLIC method, the hyperspectral images were segmented into smaller, more manageable regions, allowing for more accurate classification and detection of GB brain tumors.
